alert.note: Alert for Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 5:55PM CDT until May 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ROCK ISLAND...MERCER...NORTHWESTERN LOUISA... SOUTHERN CEDAR...WESTERN SCOTT...SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON...NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 555 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rochester to Saulsbury Bridge Campground to Cranston, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Muscatine, Fruitland, Grandview, Muscatine Municipal Airport, Sand Springs and Moscow around 605 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Wilton, Bennett, Sweetland Center, Flaming Prairie Park, Bennett Park, Fairport, New Liberty, Fairport Recreation Area, New Era, Wildcat Den State Park, Sunbury, Durant, Eliza, Illinois City, Loud Thunder Forest Preserve, Shady Creek Campground, Midway Beach, Clark`s Ferry Recreation Area, Mannon, Montpelier, Stockton, Petersville, Loud Thunder Scout Camp, Buffalo Shores, Pleasant Prairie, Plainview, Walcott, Andalusia, Edgington, Maysville, Marston, Blue Grass, Millersburg, Joy, Taylor Ridge, Hamlet, Buffalo, Reynolds, West Lake Park, Aledo Mercer County Airport and Gingle Corners. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
